intro: Trymalium daltonii, commonly known as Dalton's trymalium, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is typically found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
